title: Establishing an Emergency Board To Investigate Disputes Between Certain Railroads Represented by the National Carriers' Conference Committee of the National Railway Labor Conference and Their Employees Represented by Certain Labor Organizations

enrichment.summary: This executive order creates an Emergency Board to investigate labor disputes between certain railroads and their employees represented by labor organizations, aiming to prevent disruptions to essential interstate rail transportation. The Board will provide a report within 30 days, during which no changes can be made to the disputed conditions without agreement.
potential_concerns: The temporary freeze on changes to labor conditions may prolong tensions if parties resist compromise.
Delays in resolving disputes could still disrupt critical transportation services despite the Board's interventions.
The President's appointment power for Board members may raise concerns about impartiality among stakeholders.
Limited duration of the Board's mandate could hamper a thorough resolution of complex labor disputes.
